Package com.diy.hardware

Class PriceLookUpCode

java.lang.Object
com.diy.hardware.PriceLookUpCode
public class PriceLookUpCode extends Object
Represents a PLU value, a sequence of digits that, in principle, could lie anywhere in the range 0000-99999. Specific subranges are reserved for specific purposes in the real world, but we will not worry about that here.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a PLU code from a string of numerals.

  • Constructor Details

    • PriceLookUpCode

      public PriceLookUpCode(String code)
      Constructs a PLU code from a string of numerals. There must be at least 4 digits and at most 5.
      Parameters:
      code - A string of digits.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If any character in the input is not a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.
      SimulationException - If the code contains less than 4 digits or more than 5 digits.
      NullPointerException - If code is null.

  • Method Details

    • numeralCount

      public int numeralCount()
      Gets the count of numerals in this code.
      Returns:
      The count of numerals.

    • getNumeralAt

      public Numeral getNumeralAt(int index)
      Gets the numeral at the indicated index within the code.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the numeral, ≥0 and <count.
      Returns:
      The numeral at the indicated index.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the index is outside the legal range.
